Freshwater

Even though you may only notice water on the Earth's surface, more freshwater is stored in the ground than there is in liquid form on the surface.

In fact, some of the water you see flowing in rivers comes from water seeping into Earth's surface to become groundwater.

Water from precipitation continually seeps into the ground to fill aquifers (underground reservoirs), while at the same time water in the ground continually fills rivers through seepage.
